channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hunter Biden Gun Case Goes to Jury as Prosecutors Wrap Up Closing Arguments
item.description: Prosecutors connected dozens of evidentiary dots to try to show President Biden’s deeply troubled son willfully falsified a gun form.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.N. Security Council Passes U.S.-Backed Cease-Fire Resolution
item.description: The resolution laid out a three-phase plan that begins with an immediate cease-fire. Neither Israel nor Hamas has formally embraced the plan.

item.title: China has a ‘near monopoly’ on many critical minerals. JPMorgan says it could be the ‘next battleground’ with the U.S.
item.description: The U.S. is 100% reliant on imports for 12 minerals that are key to the production of semiconductors and other high-tech products.

item.title: Apple Intelligence Revealed at WWDC 2024 as Company Jumps Into AI Race
item.description: While other big tech companies have aggressively tried to add artificial intelligence into products, the iPhone maker has taken a more cautious approach.

item.title: Ukraine Reconstruction Official Resigns, Highlighting Tensions
item.description: The departure of the official, who had pointed up mismanagement of funds, was a blow to government efforts to assuage allies’ concerns about how aid is spent.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher sides with the enemy over actor and writer colleagues in AI debate: 'I can just generate and then watch my own movie'
item.description: Writers push back at the venture capitalist’s praise of OpenAI’s Sora.

item.title: The F.E.C. Was Deadlocked for Years. Then a Democrat Sided With the G.O.P.
item.description: Three Republicans and one Democrat have been voting together, loosening how money is raised and spent in politics at what one outside watchdog called “breathtaking” speed.

item.title: Aircraft Carrying Malawi’s Vice President Is Missing
item.description: A search is underway after the aircraft carrying Vice President Saulos Chilima and nine other people vanished.

item.title: The housing market’s pivotal spring selling season is coming to an end—not with a bang, but with a whimper
item.description: Capital Economics says “mortgage demand and sales activity won’t recover until rates fall meaningfully below 7%.” The research firm expects that to happen only later this year.

item.title: Russia Releases Female Prison Inmates to Join Ukraine War
item.description: Tens of thousands of male convicts have been freed to fight in Ukraine. It is not clear if a small contingent of female volunteers released from a prison portends wider use of female soldiers.

item.title: Russia Releases Female Prison Inmates to Join Ukraine War
item.description: Tens of thousands of male convicts have been freed to fight in Ukraine. It is not clear if a small contingent of female volunteers released from a prison portends wider use of female soldiers.

item.title: The S&P 500 is crushing diversified funds. So if you didn't bet big on the U.S. stock index, 'then you look like a moron,' portfolio expert says
item.description: Diversified portfolios have trailed the US large-cap stock index in 13 of the last 15 years, a stretch seen only once before in almost a century of data.

item.title: Germany’s AfD Rises to 2nd Place in E.U. Election
item.description: The AfD’s gains were a sharp rebuke to Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s governing coalition and a sign of the rightward political shift across the continent.

item.title: Germany’s AfD Rises to 2nd Place in E.U. Election
item.description: The AfD’s gains were a sharp rebuke to Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s governing coalition and a sign of the rightward political shift across the continent.

item.title: The biggest announcements from Apple's most important event of the year—and quite possibly ever
item.description: Artificial intelligence—rather, Apple Intelligence—was the centerpiece of the company's keynote for WWDC 2024.
